metadata.name: Desert Snow
metadata.description:
One of my favorite images from the sunny state. This single image depicts the range of geographies this state has to offer from desert lands to snow-covered mountains. On a crispy day in February, me and my wife drove in live snow to reach our destination in Eastern Sierra. I only came across this location/composition when we pulled over to take some rest after being out for 7-8 hours. Having desert shrubs and snow-covered mountains in a single frame is probably unusual if it is not for California. 

Edition 1/1
Dimensions: 6260 x 4174 (300 DPI)

License: Primary collector is free to use the image in advertising, display privately and in groups, virtual galleries, documentaries including derivative works as long as the creator is credited. Provides no rights to create commercial merchandise, commercial distribution. Copyright remains with creator.
